data.title: International
data.text:
Paul Haggis’ Name Scrubbed From Press Materials for Cannes Movie ‘5B’

Attendees at a May 16 screening of '5B' at the Cannes Film Festival got a surprise at the end of the movie when Paul Haggis' name on the credits.

Movie News

By

Roman Polanski’s Wife Criticizes Quentin Tarantino for Including Husband in ‘Once Upon a Time in Hollywood’

The wife of Roman Polanski is not pleased that her husband is a character in the upcoming Quentin Tarantino film 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood.'

Movie News

By

Spice Girls Wear a Million Crystals on World Tour

The Spice Girls are adding a little sparkle to their step for their 2019 world tour. During opening night on Friday in Dublin, the singers and their dancers debuted 100 costumes with a total of one million Swarovski crystals.

Style

By

Jafar Actor Marwan Kenzari Joins Charlize Theron in Action Thriller ‘Old Guard’ (Exclusive)

Marwan Kenzari, who plays Jafar in Disney’s live-action 'Aladdin' remake, has joined Charlize Theron and Kiki Layne in 'The Old Guard,' Skydance and Netflix’s adaptation of the comic from author Greg Rucka and artist Leandro Fernandez.

Movie News

By

CNN Cutting 13 Jobs in London in Consolidation

A spokesman for CNN International on Tuesday confirmed to The Hollywood Reporter that the company is cutting 13 positions in its London office as part of a broader consolidation, though those impacted will be reassigned.

TV News

By

‘Summer of Changsha’ (‘Liu Yu Tian’): Film Review | Cannes 2019

Chinese actor Zu Feng’s directing bow 'Summer of Changsha,' a romance between a police detective and a surgeon, screened in Cannes’ Un Certain Regard.

Movie Reviews

By

TV Ratings: 182 Million Viewers Tune In to Eurovision Song Contest

The Eurovision Song Contest secured its position as the world's most-viewed live music event, with some 182 million people watching this year's edition.

TV News

By

Netflix India Appoints Monika Shergill to Top Post

Netflix India has appointed former Viacom India executive Monika Shergill as the creative head of its local originals, based in Mumbai.

TV News

By

‘Dwelling in the Fuchun Mountains’ (‘Chun Jiang Shui Nuan’): Film Review | Cannes 2019

First-time filmmaker Gu Xiaogang's two-hour-plus 'Dwelling in the Fuchun Mountains' tracks a provincial family's transformation across four seasons.

‘Ghost Tropic’: Film Review | Cannes 2019

'Ghost Tropic,' the third feature from Flemish director Bas Devos (Berlinale Generation Grand Prix winner 'Violet') premiered in the Cannes Directors' Fortnight.

CanalPlus Buys European Pay-TV Group M7 for $1.1 Billion

French pay-TV group CanalPlus has bought European company M7, which operates pay-TV platforms in Benelux and Central Europe, for more than $1.1 billion, in a bid to expand its streaming operations and take on Netflix.

General News

By

‘The Gangster, the Cop, the Devil’: Film Review | Cannes 2019

A South Korean gang lord teams with a cocky young cop to find a killer in Lee Won-tae’s action thriller 'The Gangster, the Cop, the Devil.'

Movie Reviews

Taron Egerton Gets Gucci-fied as Elton John in ‘Rocketman’ (Exclusive)

Actor Taron Egerton, playing Elton John in 'Rocketman,' wears several Gucci looks, a label favored by the pop star.

General News

By

Jeffrey Katzenberg to Get Cannes Lions Media Person of the Year Honor

Jeffrey Katzenberg is set for a career honor as Media Person of the Year at this year’s Cannes Lions festival and will also give a keynote on his new short-form Quibi venture with CEO Meg Whitman.

Karlovy Vary Film Festival Reveals 2019 Lineup

The 54th edition of the Karlovy Vary International Film Festival announces its lineup.
